plantlist 0.6.7
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package

Looking up Family, Family Number and Order in Modern Classification Systems.

TPL.Rd

This function enables the user to search the Family/Genus/Order for higher plants under modern Classification Systems. Genus/Families relationship came from the Plant list Website.

TPL(plant.names = NULL)

Arguments

plant.names

A characteristic vector containing the species or genus of flowering plants.

Details

This function search the Family, Family Number and Order for (1) Species (2) Genus (3) Family.

Value

A data frame containing Genus (parsed from the string), Family (For Angiosperms: APGIII, For Gymnosperms: Christenhusz 2011, For lycophytes and ferns: Christenhusz 2011) orders.

Note

Please also pay attention to the following family names:

Palmae= Arecaceae

Gramineae= Poaceae

Leguminosae= Fabaceae

Guttiferae= Clusiaceae

Cruciferae= Brassicaceae

Labiatae= Lamiaceae

Compositae= Asteraceae

Umbelliferae= Apiaceae

A small proportion of genus has been divided into several genera, even being placed into different families, this will lead to multiple entries for one enquiry. Pay attention to these issues. Users need to check the acceptance based on their own experiences or knowledge. They are:

Acanthocladium, Acanthodium, Acetosella, Acosta, Adelia, Agropogon, Alliaria, Amblytropis, Amelasorbus, Ammocalamagrostis, Anacampseros, Argyrautia, Arthraxon, Asplenosorus, Asteriscium, Atomostigma, Dactyloglossum, Darcya, Dianthera, Distichia, Ditrichum, Donax, Drummondia, Dryopteris, Dudleveria, Dunalia, Dusenia, Duvalia, Eria, Eriosonia, Erucaria, Esenbeckia, Euchresta, Eucodonopsis, Eustegia, Filicula, Flemingia, Froelichia, Gastrochilus, Gerardia, Gertrudia, Gilibertia, Goeppertia, Griffithia, Grimaldia, Guidonia, Gymnotheca, Gymnotraunsteinera, Haemanthus, Harveya, Hedwigia, Heeria, Helicophyllum, Heliohebe, Hepatica, Heteroneurum, Holboellia, Honckenya, Hornschuchia, Humboldtia, Hutchinsonia, Hygrophila, Hymenolepis, Hypopterygium, Isoloma, Joannesia, Jonesia, Kaulfussia, Laeliocattleya, Lamprophyllum, Lasia, Laxmannia, Lepidostemon, Leptopyrum, Lichtensteinia, Lightfootia, Limnobium, Lophiocarpus, Lopholepis, Lumnitzera, Malacocarpus, Mammea, Manettia, Mannia, Massularia, Mastigophora, Meeboldia, Mertensia, Meyenia, Micranthus, Micromitrium, Miltonidium, Mnium, Mollia, Moniera, Myconia, Myrmecophila, Myzorrhiza, Neesia, Nivenia, Odontitella, Omalanthus, Onychium, Orchidactyla, Orchigymnadenia, Orchiserapias, Oreocallis, Ornithocidium, Oxymitra, Pachyneurum, Pachypodium, Pachyveria, Pancovia, Panzeria, Parmentiera, Parsonsia, Petagnia, Phalangium, Swartzia, Thomandersia, Tillandsia, Trichocyclus, Tricholepis, Trisetokoeleria, Triticale, Triticosecale, Tulasnea, Uncaria, Urtica, Usteria, Vandopsis, Wahlenbergia, Waitzia, Washingtonia, Webera, References

Bremer, Birgitta, K. Bremer, Mark Chase, Mike Fay, James Reveal, Douglas Soltis, Pamella Soltis and Peter Stevens. (2009) "An update of the Angiosperm Phylogeny Group classification for the orders and families of flowering plants: APG III." Botanical Journal of the Linnean Society.

Christenhusz, M., Zhang, X. C., and Schneider, H. (2011). A linear sequence of extant families and genera of lycophytes and ferns. Phytotaxa. 19:7-54

Christenhusz, M., Reveal, J., Farjon, A., Gardner, M. F., Mill, R. R., and Chase, M. W. (2011). A new classification and linear sequence of extant gymnosperms. Phytotaxa. 19:55-70

Haston, E., Richardson, J. E., Stevens, P. F., Chase, M. W. and Harris, D. J. (2009). The Linear Angiosperm Phylogeny Group (LAPG) III: a linear sequence of the families in APG III. Botanical Journal of the Linnean Society, 161(2), 128-131.

Liu Bing, Ye Jianfei , Liu Su, Wang Yuan, Yang Yong, Lai Yangjun, Zeng Gang and Lin Qinwen(2015). Families and genera of Chinese angiosperms: a synoptic classification based on APG III. Biodiversity Science. 23(2), 225-231.

Checklist of Genera of Higher Plants at the Plant List Website: http://www.theplantlist.org/1.1/browse/-/-/

Author

Jinlong Zhang jinlongzhang01@gmail.com

See also

taxa.table, for generating taxa table for Phylomatic.

Examples


TPL("Carex")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP
#> 1       Carex          Carex Cyperaceae    APGIII_099 Poales Angiosperms
TPL("Apple")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER ORDER GROUP
#> 1       Apple          Apple   <NA>          <NA>  <NA>  <NA>
splist <- c( "Ranunculus japonicus", 
             "Solanum nigrum", 
             "Punica sp.", 
             "Machilus", "Today", "####" ) 
res <- TPL(splist)
taxa.table(res)

#> [1] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_japonicus"
#> [2] "Solanaceae/Solanum/Solanum_nigrum"            
#> [3] "Lythraceae/Punica/Punica_sp."                 
#> [4] "Lauraceae/Machilus/Machilus"                  
#> [5] "NA/Today/Today"                               
#> [6] "NA/####/####"                                 

TPL("Arecaceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP
#> 1   Arecaceae      Arecaceae Arecaceae    APGIII_076 Arecales Angiosperms
TPL("Palmae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP
#> 1      Palmae         Palmae Arecaceae    APGIII_076 Arecales Angiosperms

TPL("Poaceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS  FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP
#> 1     Poaceae        Poaceae Poaceae    APGIII_106 Poales Angiosperms
TPL("Gramineae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS  FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP
#> 1   Gramineae      Gramineae Poaceae    APGIII_106 Poales Angiosperms

TPL("Fabaceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP
#> 1    Fabaceae       Fabaceae Fabaceae    APGIII_144 Fabales Angiosperms
TPL("Leguminosae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP
#> 1 Leguminosae    Leguminosae Fabaceae    APGIII_144 Fabales Angiosperms

TPL("Clusiaceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER        ORDER       GROUP
#> 1  Clusiaceae     Clusiaceae Clusiaceae    APGIII_211 Malpighiales Angiosperms
TPL("Guttiferae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER        ORDER       GROUP
#> 1  Guttiferae     Guttiferae Clusiaceae    APGIII_211 Malpighiales Angiosperms

TPL("Brassicaceae")

#>    YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS       FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER       ORDER
#> 1 Brassicaceae   Brassicaceae Brassicaceae    APGIII_273 Brassicales
#>         GROUP
#> 1 Angiosperms
TPL("Cruciferae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS       FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER       ORDER       GROUP
#> 1  Cruciferae     Cruciferae Brassicaceae    APGIII_273 Brassicales Angiosperms

TPL("Lamiaceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP
#> 1   Lamiaceae      Lamiaceae Lamiaceae    APGIII_373 Lamiales Angiosperms
TPL("Labiatae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP
#> 1    Labiatae       Labiatae Lamiaceae    APGIII_373 Lamiales Angiosperms

TPL("Asteraceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER     ORDER       GROUP
#> 1  Asteraceae     Asteraceae Asteraceae    APGIII_400 Asterales Angiosperms
TPL("Compositae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER     ORDER       GROUP
#> 1  Compositae     Compositae Asteraceae    APGIII_400 Asterales Angiosperms

TPL("Apiaceae")

#>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP
#> 1    Apiaceae       Apiaceae Apiaceae    APGIII_413 Apiales Angiosperms
TPL("Umbelliferae")

#>    YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP
#> 1 Umbelliferae   Umbelliferae Apiaceae    APGIII_413 Apiales Angiosperms
